creditline: Gift of Harold and Mickey Smith
description: small rectangular case with hinged lid; square filigree 'cage' with floral designs and 2 panels of paired crowned lions; scalloped grid incised overall
provenance: (Moriah Galleries, New York); Collection of Harold & Mickey Smith, St. Paul, Minnesota purchased 1976; Gift to the MIA in 2001.
text: These intricately filigreed silver boxes were made to cover leather Tefillin boxes containing passages from the Torah.  Deuteronomy 6:8 instructs, "And you shall bind them as a sign on your hand, and they shall be for frontlets between your eyes."  Traditional Jewish men attach the Tefillin to the head and arm with leather straps during morning prayers.
title: Tefillin (prayer container) box (one of a pair)
